bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 84 (Tuesday, May 5, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PRICE of North Carolina:H.R. 6702.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1, which states: ``TheCongress shall have Power To . . . provide for the commonDefence and general Welfare of the United States . . .''[Page H1979]

item.fullName: Rep. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.name: Corporation for National and Community Service
Emergency medical services and trauma care
Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

item.text:
Pandemic Response and Opportunity Through National Service Act

This bill expands, and modifies the priorities and administration of, national service programs, including AmeriCorps and Senior Corps, to address the COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019) pandemic and its recovery period. Among other changes, the bill increases the number of national service positions, as well as the living allowances and other benefits associated with these positions. The living allowance is also excluded from gross income for federal tax purposes.

In addition, the Corporation for National and Community Service must (1) establish a pilot project to allow state service commissions to directly place individuals, and (2) disseminate national service opportunities through a promotional campaign and other means.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Pandemic Response and Opportunity Through National Service Act

item.title: Pandemic Response and Opportunity Through National Service Act
Pandemic Response and Opportunity Through National Service Act

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Pandemic Response and Opportunity Through National Service Act

To amend the national service laws to prioritize national service programs and projects that are directly related to the response to and recovery from the COVID-19 public health emergency, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Education and Labor, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
